Portal ist ein Rätselspiel von Valve, bei dem ihr euch in der Ego-Perspektive durch verschiedene Testkammern einer Forschungseinrichtung teleportiert.
Ihr wacht in einem einsamen Glas Kubus auf und werdet von einer K.I. namens Glados zu verschiedenen Tests gebeten. Diese K.I. verspricht euch Kuchen, wenn ihr die Tests erfolgreich besteht. Als wäre das nicht schon Ansporn genug, motiviert das Spiel durch eine gut von der Hand gehende Spielmechanik. Im Laufe des Spiels findet ihr die ikonische Portal-Gun mit dem ihr Portale verschießen könnt. So eröffnen sich viele neue Möglichkeiten die Testkammern zu durchqueren. Ihr könnt damit 2 Portale verschießen, was durch Portal A geht, kommt an Portal B wieder raus.
Die Steuerung ist Shooter typisch und wird dem Spieler Schritt für Schritt beigebracht. Die Grafik ist in Ordnung und macht auch im Jahr 2022 noch einen soliden Eindruck. Die Geschichte hat mich direkt von Minute 1 an gefesselt und ist wirklich etwas ganz besonderes. 
Die Soundkulisse ist wirklich sehr stark und die gesprochen Dialoge benfalls sehr überzeugend.
Auch für dieses Spiel gilt: Es gehört in wirklich jede Steam-Bibliothek. Ob jung oder alt.. man sollte es wirklich mal gespielt haben.
It's like minecraft... but with portals

Only now have I finally started playing through the Portal games and man have I been missing out! I'm not really a fan of most puzzles in games, as most of the time they kill the pacing and I just go look up a guide so I can get through it quickly. Portal on the other hand, took an aspect of games I usually don't like and made it really fun with the portal gun!

Most of the areas felt just the right amount of challenging while also being very fun to go through. There were a few areas that stumped me, but I felt really proud of myself when I was able to get through a tough area without looking up a guide. The level design is crafted well, and it just felt like a fun world to explore. 

While you don't you get any weapons aside for the portal gun, the game still has combat to a degree, as you are sometimes dropped in these areas where there are turrets everywhere, and you have to use the portal gun in creative ways to sneak up behind them, or drop them in a portal to somewhere else. How Valve was able to approach combat situations with puzzle solving was a masterclass in creative level design! 

I also really enjoyed the story and Glados as antagonist with her sarcastic commentary as you play through the game. I remember playing through the training levels until I found the first room outside of the training course that hinted at what was really going on and I just loved it! 

The game is very short though, but I have heard that like Left 4 Dead, the first game is really just a demo and a foundation that the second game expands on, so I look forward to playing Portal 2 now! Overall, this is definitely worth a play, especially since its usually dirt cheap!

Around 3:20 am on February 25, 2016, [i]Greg Gunn[/i] was walking home unarmed from a card game when he encountered [i]Aaron Cody Smith[/i], a white police officer, who was patrolling the neighborhood. Smith stopped Gunn and performed a stop-and-frisk; during the encounter, Gunn fled. Smith pursued, initially attempting to use a Taser to disable Gunn, and when that failed he began striking Gunn with his baton. According to Smith's later testimony, Gunn then picked up a painter's pole, which caused Smith to fire his service weapon in what he described as self-defense. Smith shot seven times, hitting Gunn five times and killing him. Smith was found guilty of manslaughter, and, in January 2020, was sentenced to 14 years in prison.
[b]Source[/b]: Wikipedia

Jugué primero el segundo juego y evidentemente tiene mejores ajustes tanto visuales como de jugabilidad, pero el primero te ayuda a comprender la historia y sacarte una que otra carcajada con el característico humor que representa a la máquila GLaDOS. 
Para mi ambos son juegos muy bienos y aún con el pasar de los años siguen siendo una excelente opción para divertirse.
